name: Paneer Butter Masala
about: A rich and creamy North Indian curry made with paneer (cottage cheese) in a tomato-based gravy with aromatic spices.
preparationSteps: Heat butter in a pan and sauté ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
Add spices and simmer for 5 minutes.
Add paneer cubes and cream.
Cook for 10 minutes on low heat.
Garnish with kasuri methi and serve hot.

name: Vegetable Biryani
about: A fragrant and flavorful rice dish made with aromatic spices, basmati rice, and a mix of fresh vegetables.
ingredients: 1 cup Mixed vegetables (carrot, beans, peas, potato)
Fresh coriander and mint for garnish
preparationSteps: Rinse and soak basmati rice for 20 minutes.
Heat ghee in a pan, sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste, tomatoes, and cook until soft.
Mix in chopped vegetables, biryani masala, turmeric, and chili powder.
Stir in yogurt, cook for 5 minutes, then add water and salt.
Add soaked rice, cover, and cook on low heat until rice is fluffy.
Garnish with fresh coriander and mint, serve hot.

name: Dal Makhani
about: A rich and creamy North Indian lentil dish made with black lentils (urad dal) and kidney beans (rajma) slow-cooked with butter, cream, and aromatic spices.
preparationSteps: Soak black lentils and kidney beans overnight, then pressure cook until soft.
Heat butter in a pan and sauté ginger-garlic paste.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
Add cooked lentils, spices, and simmer for 20 minutes.
Stir in cream and cook on low heat for 10 more minutes.
Garnish with kasuri methi and serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Palak Soup
about: A nutritious and flavorful soup made with fresh spinach (palak), blended with spices and cream for a smooth texture.
preparationSteps: Heat butter in a pan and sauté onion and garlic until soft.
Add chopped spinach and cook until wilted.
Pour in vegetable broth and let it simmer for 5 minutes.
Blend the mixture until smooth.
Return to heat, add milk or cream, and season with salt and pepper.
Simmer for 5 minutes, then add lemon juice before serving.

name: Rajma Chawal
about: A comforting North Indian dish made with red kidney beans cooked in a spiced tomato-onion gravy, served with steamed rice.
ingredients: 1 cup Rajma (red kidney beans), soaked overnight
preparationSteps: Soak rajma overnight and drain the water.
Pressure cook rajma with 3 cups water and a little salt until soft (about 6–7 whistles).
Heat oil or ghee in a pan, sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
Add coriander powder, cumin powder, chili powder, turmeric, and salt. Cook for 2–3 minutes.
Add the cooked rajma along with its water and simmer for 15–20 minutes.
Add garam masala, mix well, and cook for 2 more minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Chole Bhature
about: A popular North Indian dish consisting of spicy chickpea curry (chole) served with deep-fried, fluffy bread (bhature).
preparationSteps: Soak chickpeas overnight and drain the water.
Pressure cook chickpeas with 3 cups water and salt until soft (about 6–7 whistles).
Heat oil in a pan, sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1 minute.
Add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
Add coriander powder, cumin powder, chili powder, turmeric, chole masala, and salt. Cook for 2–3 minutes.
Add cooked chickpeas along with their water and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add garam masala, mix well, and cook for 2 more minutes.
For bhature: Mix flour, semolina, baking powder, and salt. Add yogurt and knead into a soft dough, adding water as needed.
Cover the dough and let it rest for 2 hours.
Divide dough into balls, roll into discs, and deep fry until puffed and golden.
Serve hot chole with fluffy bhature and sliced onions.

name: Masala Dosa
about: A crispy South Indian crepe made from fermented rice and lentil batter, stuffed with a spiced potato filling and served with chutneys and sambar.
preparationSteps: Wash and soak rice, urad dal, chana dal, and fenugreek seeds for 6–8 hours.
Grind to a smooth batter, adding water as needed.
Add salt and ferment batter overnight or 8–10 hours until fluffy.
For masala filling: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds, cumin seeds, curry leaves, and green chilies.
Add sliced onions and sauté until soft.
Add turmeric powder and boiled potatoes. Mix well and season with salt.
Cook for 2–3 minutes and garnish with coriander leaves.
Heat a non-stick pan, pour a ladle of batter, and spread thin in a circular motion.
Drizzle some oil around edges and cook until golden and crispy.
Place potato masala in the center, fold dosa, and serve with coconut chutney and sambar.

name: Pav Bhaji
about: A popular Mumbai street food consisting of a spicy vegetable mash served with butter-toasted bread rolls.
ingredients: 2 tbsp Butter (plus more for toasting pav)
preparationSteps: Heat butter in a large pan. Add onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, sauté for a minute.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft and mushy.
Add pav bhaji masala, turmeric, and red chili powder. Mix well.
Add boiled potatoes, cauliflower, capsicum, and green peas. Mash everything with a potato masher.
Add salt and water to adjust consistency. Let it simmer for 5–7 minutes.
Garnish with coriander leaves and a knob of butter.
For pav: Slice pav rolls, toast with butter on a hot tawa until golden.
Serve bhaji hot with butter-toasted pav, lemon wedges, and chopped onions.

name: Dhokla
about: A soft, spongy steamed snack from Gujarat made with fermented gram flour batter, seasoned with mustard seeds and green chilies.
preparationSteps: In a mixing bowl, combine gram flour, yogurt, water, ginger-green chili paste, turmeric, lemon juice, and salt to make a smooth batter.
Just before steaming, add Eno fruit salt and mix gently. The batter will become fluffy.
Pour batter into a greased steaming tray and steam for 15–20 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.
Heat oil in a small pan, add mustard seeds, curry leaves, and slit green chilies. Let them splutter.
Pour this tempering over the steamed dhokla.
Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and grated coconut if desired.
Cut into squares and serve with green chutney.

name: Veg Momo
about: Soft dumplings stuffed with finely chopped vegetables, a popular street food in India with origins in Tibet and Nepal.
preparationSteps: In a bowl, mix all-purpose flour, salt, and enough water to make a soft dough. Cover and let it rest for 20–30 minutes.
Heat oil in a pan, add garlic, ginger, and green chilies, and sauté until fragrant.
Add cabbage, carrot, capsicum, and spring onions. Stir-fry on high heat for 2–3 minutes.
Add soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Mix well and cook for another minute. Let the filling cool.
Roll small portions of dough into thin circles. Place a spoonful of filling in the center.
Fold and pleat the edges to seal the momos.
Steam in a steamer for 8–10 minutes until the momos turn slightly translucent.
Serve hot with spicy red chutney.

name: Butter Chicken
about: A rich and creamy North Indian dish made with tender chicken cooked in a spiced tomato-butter sauce.
ingredients: 500g Chicken, boneless and cut into pieces
preparationSteps: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, chili powder, and salt for 30 minutes.
Heat butter in a pan, cook marinated chicken until lightly browned.
Remove chicken and set aside.
In the same pan, add tomato puree and cook until oil separates.
Stir in garam masala, kasuri methi, and cooked chicken.
Pour in heavy cream, mix well, and simmer for 10 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with naan or rice.

name: Chicken Biryani
about: A delicious and aromatic rice dish made with marinated chicken, basmati rice, and a blend of fragrant spices.
ingredients: Fresh coriander and mint for garnish
preparationSteps: Marinate chicken with yogurt, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric, chili powder, and salt for 30 minutes
Rinse and soak basmati rice for 20 minutes
Heat ghee in a pan, sauté onions until golden brown
Add tomatoes and cook until soft
Add marinated chicken and cook until browned
Stir in biryani masala, then add water or chicken broth
Add soaked rice, cover, and cook on low heat until rice is fluffy and chicken is tender
Garnish with fresh coriander and mint, serve hot

name: Mutton Rogan Josh
about: A rich and aromatic Kashmiri delicacy made with tender mutton pieces slow-cooked in a blend of flavorful spices and yogurt.
preparationSteps: Heat mustard oil until it starts smoking. Reduce heat and fry bay leaves, cloves, cardamoms, and cinnamon for a few seconds.
Add onions and sauté until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook for 1–2 minutes until raw smell disappears.
Add mutton pieces and fry on medium heat until they turn brown.
Mix turmeric powder, Kashmiri red chili powder, fennel powder, and dry ginger powder into whisked yogurt.
Add the yogurt mixture to the mutton and cook on low heat, stirring continuously to avoid curdling.
Add salt and 1–2 cups of water, cover, and cook on low flame until mutton is tender (around 45–60 minutes).
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with steamed rice or naan.

name: Tandoori Chicken
about: A classic North Indian dish where chicken is marinated in yogurt and aromatic spices, then roasted to perfection for a smoky, charred flavor.
ingredients: 500g Chicken (with bone, preferably leg and thigh pieces)
Onion rings and lemon wedges for serving
preparationSteps: Clean and pat dry the chicken pieces. Make deep cuts on them for better marination.
In a large bowl, mix yogurt, lemon juice, ginger-garlic paste, Kashmiri red chili powder, turmeric, garam masala, coriander powder, cumin powder, mustard oil, and salt.
Coat the chicken pieces well with the marinade, making sure it enters the cuts. Cover and refrigerate for at least 4–6 hours (overnight is best).
Preheat the oven to 200°C. Place the marinated chicken on a grill rack over a baking tray.
Roast for 20–25 minutes, turn the pieces, and roast for another 15–20 minutes until fully cooked and slightly charred.
Alternatively, cook in a tandoor or on a grill pan for authentic smoky flavor.
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with onion rings and lemon wedges.

name: Fish Curry
about: A delicious and aromatic Indian fish curry made with tender fish pieces simmered in a spiced coconut or tomato-based gravy.
ingredients: 500g Fish (Pomfret, Kingfish, or any firm fish), cut into pieces
1 cup Coconut milk (or water for a lighter version)
preparationSteps: Heat oil in a pan, add mustard seeds and curry leaves, and let them splutter
Sauté onions until golden brown, then add ginger-garlic paste
Mix in tomato puree, turmeric, chili powder, cumin, and coriander powder
Cook until the oil separates from the masala
Add coconut milk and tamarind paste, mix well
Gently add fish pieces, cover, and cook for 10 minutes until tender
Sprinkle garam masala and garnish with fresh coriander
Serve hot with steamed rice or roti

name: Prawn Masala
about: A spicy and flavorful Indian dish made with prawns cooked in a rich tomato-based masala with aromatic spices.
preparationSteps: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown
Add ginger-garlic paste and cook until fragrant
Mix in tomato puree, turmeric, chili powder, cumin, and coriander powder
Cook until the oil separates from the masala
Add prawns, salt, and cook for 5-7 minutes until they turn pink and tender
Stir in garam masala and kasuri methi, mix well
Garnish with fresh coriander and serve hot with rice or roti

name: Egg Curry
about: A comforting and flavorful dish made with boiled eggs simmered in a rich, spiced onion-tomato gravy, perfect with rice or roti.
preparationSteps: Peel the boiled eggs and make small slits on them.
Heat 1 tbsp oil in a pan, lightly fry the eggs until golden, and set aside.
In the same pan, add the remaining oil and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, and cook for 1–2 minutes.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft and oil starts to separate.
Mix in turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt. Cook the spices for 2 minutes.
Add a little water to make a thick gravy, then add garam masala and crushed kasuri methi.
Add the fried eggs to the gravy, gently mix, and simmer for 5 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves and serve hot with steamed rice or roti.

name: Keema Pav
about: A popular Mumbai street food made with spicy minced meat curry served with buttery pav buns, perfect for a hearty meal.
preparationSteps: Heat oil in a pan and sauté onions until golden brown.
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies, cook for 1–2 minutes.
Add tomatoes and cook until soft and oil separates.
Mix in turmeric, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, and salt. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add minced meat and cook on medium heat until it changes color.
Pour in some water, cover, and cook for 15–20 minutes until the meat is tender.
Add garam masala and crushed kasuri methi, mix well, and cook for 2–3 minutes.
Garnish with fresh coriander leaves.
Toast pav buns with butter on a hot tawa.
Serve hot keema with buttery pav and lemon wedges.

name: Grilled Salmon
about: A healthy and flavorful dish where fresh salmon fillets are marinated with herbs and spices, then grilled to perfection for a smoky, tender finish.
ingredients: Freshly ground black pepper to taste
Fresh dill or parsley for garnish
preparationSteps: In a small bowl, mix olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, oregano, paprika, salt, and black pepper.
Brush the marinade over both sides of the salmon fillets and let them rest for 15–20 minutes.
Preheat a grill or grill pan over medium-high heat.
Place the salmon fillets skin-side down on the grill and cook for 4–5 minutes.
Flip and cook for another 3–4 minutes until the salmon is cooked through but still moist inside.
Remove from the grill and garnish with fresh dill or parsley.
Serve hot with lemon wedges and your choice of side salad or grilled vegetables.

name: Chicken Shawarma
about: A Middle Eastern street food favorite where marinated chicken is grilled or roasted, then served with pita bread, fresh veggies, and creamy sauces.
ingredients: Freshly ground black pepper to taste
Fresh lettuce, tomatoes, onions for filling
Garlic sauce or tahini sauce for dressing
preparationSteps: In a large bowl, mix yogurt, olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, cumin, paprika, turmeric, coriander, cinnamon, salt, and black pepper.
Add chicken pieces to the marinade, coat well, and refrigerate for at least 1–2 hours (overnight for best flavor).
Preheat a grill pan or skillet over medium-high heat.
Cook the marinated chicken for 5–6 minutes per side until fully cooked and slightly charred.
Remove from heat and slice into thin strips.
Warm pita bread and layer with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and sliced chicken.
Drizzle with garlic sauce or tahini sauce, wrap, and serve hot.

name: Gulab Jamun
about: A classic Indian dessert made from deep-fried milk-based dumplings soaked in a fragrant sugar syrup.
ingredients: 1/4 cup Milk (warm, as needed for kneading)
Oil or ghee for deep frying
preparationSteps: In a bowl, mix milk powder, all-purpose flour, and baking soda
Add ghee and mix until the mixture becomes crumbly
Gradually add warm milk and knead into a soft dough (do not over-knead)
Cover and let it rest for 10 minutes, then shape into smooth, crack-free balls
Heat oil or ghee on low-medium flame and fry the balls until golden brown
For sugar syrup: Boil sugar and water until slightly sticky, then add cardamom, rose water, and lemon juice
Add the fried gulab jamuns to the warm syrup and let them soak for at least 2 hours
Serve warm or chilled, garnished with chopped nuts if desired

name: Rasgulla
about: A soft and spongy Bengali dessert made from chhena (Indian cottage cheese) balls cooked in a light sugar syrup.
preparationSteps: Boil milk, then add lemon juice or vinegar to curdle it
Strain the curdled milk using a muslin cloth and rinse with cold water to remove acidity
Hang the chhena for 30 minutes to remove excess water
Knead the chhena for 5-7 minutes until smooth and soft
Add corn flour (if using) and knead again, then shape into small, smooth balls
In a wide pan, boil water and sugar to make syrup, adding cardamom pods
Drop the chhena balls into boiling syrup and cook covered for 15-20 minutes on medium heat
Turn off the heat and let them cool in the syrup
Add rose water if desired and refrigerate before serving chilled

name: Jalebi
about: A crispy, deep-fried Indian dessert soaked in sugar syrup, known for its spiral shape and sweet, tangy flavor.
ingredients: 1/2 tsp Turmeric or saffron for color (optional)
Oil or ghee for deep frying
preparationSteps: In a bowl, mix all-purpose flour, corn flour, yogurt, and baking soda
Gradually add warm water to make a smooth, thick batter and let it ferment for 6-8 hours
For sugar syrup: Boil sugar and water until sticky (1-string consistency), then add lemon juice, cardamom powder, and rose water
Heat oil or ghee in a pan, fill a piping bag or squeeze bottle with the batter, and pipe spirals into hot oil
Fry until golden and crisp, then dip immediately into warm sugar syrup for 30 seconds
Remove and serve hot, garnished with saffron strands or chopped nuts

name: Falooda
about: A rich and refreshing Indian dessert drink made with milk, basil seeds, falooda sev, rose syrup, and ice cream.
ingredients: 1 scoop Vanilla or kulfi ice cream
Chopped fruits (like mango or strawberry, optional)
preparationSteps: Soak basil seeds in water for 10-15 minutes until they expand
Boil falooda sev as per package instructions, then drain and cool
In a glass, add rose syrup at the bottom
Layer soaked basil seeds, cooked falooda sev, and chilled milk
Add sugar if needed and mix gently
Top with a scoop of ice cream, chopped nuts, and jelly cubes (if using)
Serve immediately with a long spoon and straw

name: Kheer
about: A traditional Indian rice pudding made with milk, rice, and sugar, flavored with cardamom and garnished with nuts and dried fruits.
preparationSteps: Wash the rice thoroughly and soak it in water for 30 minutes.
In a heavy-bottomed pan, bring the milk to a boil.
Drain the soaked rice and add it to the boiling milk.
Cook on low flame, stirring occasionally to prevent sticking, until the rice becomes soft and the milk thickens.
Add sugar and mix until it dissolves completely.
Stir in cardamom powder, saffron strands, and half of the chopped nuts.
Simmer for another 5 minutes, then turn off the heat.
Garnish with remaining nuts and raisins.
Serve warm or chilled.

name: Ladoo
about: A popular Indian sweet made from flour, ghee, and sugar, often flavored with cardamom and garnished with nuts.
preparationSteps: Heat ghee in a heavy-bottomed pan on low flame.
Add the besan and roast it, stirring continuously, until it turns golden brown and releases a nutty aroma.
Turn off the heat and let it cool slightly.
Add powdered sugar, cardamom powder, and mix well.
Stir in chopped nuts and raisins.
While the mixture is still warm, shape it into round ladoos using your palms.
Allow them to cool completely before storing.
Store in an airtight container.

name: Barfi
about: A rich and creamy Indian sweet made with milk solids, sugar, and flavored with cardamom, often garnished with nuts or silver leaf.
preparationSteps: Crumble the khoya and set aside.
In a pan, add sugar and water. Boil to make a one-string consistency syrup.
Add the crumbled khoya to the syrup and mix well.
Cook the mixture on low flame until it thickens and starts leaving the sides of the pan.
Add cardamom powder and mix again.
Grease a tray with ghee and spread the mixture evenly.
Garnish with chopped nuts and optional silver leaf.
Let it cool completely, then cut into squares or diamonds.

name: Kulfi
about: A traditional Indian frozen dessert made with thickened milk, flavored with cardamom, saffron, and nuts for a rich and creamy taste.
preparationSteps: Boil the milk in a heavy-bottomed pan and simmer until it reduces to half, stirring frequently.
Add sugar, condensed milk, and saffron strands; mix well.
Add cardamom powder and chopped nuts, then cook for another 5 minutes.
Let the mixture cool to room temperature.
Pour into kulfi molds or small cups, cover, and freeze for 6-8 hours or until set.
To serve, dip the mold in warm water for a few seconds and gently remove the kulfi.

name: Chocolate Cake
about: A rich and moist chocolate cake made with cocoa powder, layered with creamy chocolate frosting for a decadent dessert.
preparationSteps: Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F) and grease a cake tin.
In a large mixing bowl, sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and baking soda.
Add sugar, oil, milk, and vanilla essence; mix until smooth.
Stir in vinegar and mix gently.
Pour the batter into the prepared tin and bake for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Let the cake cool completely before frosting with chocolate ganache or icing.

name: Peda
about: A soft and sweet Indian milk-based dessert made with khoya, sugar, and flavored with cardamom, often garnished with nuts.
preparationSteps: In a pan, heat ghee and add khoya, stirring until it melts.
Add condensed milk and milk powder, mixing well to form a dough-like consistency.
Cook on low heat for 5-7 minutes until the mixture thickens.
Remove from heat, add cardamom powder, and let it cool slightly.
Grease your hands with ghee and shape the mixture into small round balls or discs.
Garnish with chopped nuts and let them cool completely before serving.

name: Fruit Custard
about: A creamy dessert made with custard and a variety of fresh fruits, served chilled for a refreshing treat.
preparationSteps: In a small bowl, mix custard powder with 3-4 tablespoons of cold milk to make a smooth paste.
Boil the remaining milk in a saucepan, add sugar, and stir until dissolved.
Add the custard paste to the boiling milk, stirring continuously to avoid lumps.
Cook for 2-3 minutes until the custard thickens, then turn off the heat.
Let the custard cool to room temperature, then refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Before serving, add all the chopped fruits and mix gently.
Serve chilled.

name: Masala Chai
about: A fragrant and spiced Indian tea made by brewing black tea leaves with aromatic spices, milk, and sugar.
ingredients: 2 tsp Black tea leaves (or 2 tea bags)
preparationSteps: In a saucepan, bring water to a boil
Add crushed cardamom, cinnamon, cloves, black pepper, and grated ginger
Simmer for 2-3 minutes to infuse the flavors
Add black tea leaves and let it brew for 3-4 minutes
Pour in milk and sugar, stir well, and bring to a gentle boil
Strain the tea into cups and serve hot

name: Lassi (Sweet & Salty)
about: A refreshing and creamy yogurt-based Indian drink, available in both sweet and salty variations.
ingredients: 2 tbsp Sugar or honey (adjust to taste)
1/2 tsp Black salt (optional, for extra flavor)
preparationSteps: In a blender, add yogurt, chilled water or milk, and ice cubes
For sweet lassi: Add sugar, cardamom powder, and blend until frothy
For salty lassi: Add salt, roasted cumin powder, and blend well
Pour into glasses and garnish with nuts (for sweet) or coriander leaves (for salty)
Serve chilled and enjoy!

name: Filter Coffee
about: A rich and aromatic South Indian coffee made using a traditional filter, blended with frothy milk for a smooth and bold taste.
ingredients: 2 tbsp Ground coffee powder (South Indian filter coffee blend)
preparationSteps: Add coffee powder to the upper chamber of a traditional South Indian coffee filter
Pour hot water over the coffee and let it drip into the lower chamber (takes about 10-15 minutes)
Boil milk and mix with the brewed coffee decoction
Add sugar as per taste and mix well
Pour the coffee back and forth between two cups to create froth
Serve hot in a traditional tumbler and dabarah (small bowl) for authentic taste

name: Thandai
about: A refreshing and aromatic Indian beverage made with milk, nuts, and a blend of spices, traditionally enjoyed during festivals like Holi and Mahashivratri.
ingredients: Chilled water or ice cubes (optional, for a lighter version)
preparationSteps: Soak almonds, cashews, pistachios, poppy seeds, fennel seeds, and cardamom in warm water for 2-3 hours
Blend the soaked ingredients with black pepper and a little milk to form a smooth paste
Boil milk, add the prepared paste, and mix well
Stir in sugar, saffron, and rose water (if using), and let it cool
Refrigerate for 1-2 hours for flavors to blend
Strain (optional) and serve chilled, garnished with chopped nuts

name: Cold Coffee
about: A chilled, frothy blend of coffee, milk, and sugar, perfect for a refreshing caffeine boost on a hot day.
preparationSteps: In a blender, add instant coffee powder, sugar, and cold water. Blend until the mixture becomes frothy.
Add cold milk and ice cubes, then blend again until smooth and creamy.
For extra flavor, drizzle chocolate syrup inside the serving glasses.
Pour the cold coffee into glasses and top with whipped cream if desired.
Serve immediately.

name: Nimbu Pani
about: A refreshing Indian lemonade made with fresh lemon juice, water, sugar, and a hint of salt for a perfect summer drink.
preparationSteps: Cut the lemons and extract the juice into a bowl.
In a jug, mix lemon juice, sugar, salt, and black salt.
Add cold water and stir until the sugar dissolves completely.
Add ice cubes and garnish with fresh mint leaves.
Serve chilled.

name: Mango Shake
about: A rich and creamy summer drink made with fresh ripe mangoes, milk, and sugar — perfect for a refreshing treat.
preparationSteps: Add chopped mangoes, sugar, and chilled milk to a blender.
Blend until smooth and creamy.
Add ice cubes and blend again for a frothy texture.
Pour into glasses and top with vanilla ice cream if desired.
Garnish with chopped nuts and serve immediately.

name: Hot Chocolate
about: A rich, velvety drink made with cocoa, milk, and sugar — perfect for cozy evenings.
preparationSteps: Heat milk in a saucepan over medium heat.
Whisk in cocoa powder and sugar until well combined.
Add chopped dark chocolate and stir until melted and smooth.
Pour into mugs and top with whipped cream.
Garnish with chocolate shavings and serve hot.

name: Green Tea
about: A soothing and healthy drink made by steeping green tea leaves, rich in antioxidants.
ingredients: 1 tsp Green tea leaves (or 1 tea bag)
preparationSteps: Bring water to a gentle boil.
Remove from heat and add green tea leaves or tea bag.
Steep for 2–3 minutes (avoid over-steeping to prevent bitterness).
Strain if using loose leaves.
Add honey or lemon if desired and serve warm.

name: Rose Milk
about: A fragrant, sweet drink made with chilled milk and rose syrup, perfect for summer.
preparationSteps: In a glass, add rose syrup.
Pour in chilled milk and mix well.
Add ice cubes and stir before serving.

name: Coconut Water
about: A naturally refreshing drink from tender coconuts, rich in electrolytes and nutrients.
preparationSteps: Cut open the tender coconut carefully.
Pour the coconut water into a glass.
Serve chilled for best taste.
